snippet.title: Shia LaBeouf Seeks 'Long-Term Inpatient Treatment' Following Sexual Battery Lawsuit
snippet.description: According to his lawyer Shawn Holley, the 'Transformers' actor is currently 'actively seeking the kind of meaningful, intensive, long-term inpatient treatment that he desperately needs.'  Dec 26, 2020   AceShowbiz - Shia LaBeouf is reportedly trying to work on himself after being accused of sexual abuse by ex-girlfriend FKA twigs. According to his lawyer Shawn Holley, the "Transformers" actor is currently seeking for a "long-term inpatient treatment."    Speaking with Variety on Thursday, December 24, "Shia needs help and he knows that." He went on saying, "We are actively seeking the kind of meaningful, intensive, long-term inpatient treatment that he desperately needs."    "When these allegations first came up a year ago, Shia immediately accepted responsibility for the many things he had done wrong and expressed his willingness to do what Twigs wanted him to do, almost all of which were perfectly reasonable," the site went on to state.      See also...  Miley Cyrus Is Naughty Santa ...
